subject: Leadership
title: Data-Driven Strategy
description: A short lesson to help you apply Data-Driven Strategy.

hook.text: Netflix used viewing data to greenlight House of Cards before shooting a single scene. The data said it would work.

buildup.text: Data-driven strategy replaces gut feelings with evidence. Measure what matters and let data guide choices.

discovery.text: The key isn't having more dataâ€”it's asking better questions. Good strategy starts with the right hypothesis to test.

twist.text: Data can mislead. Correlation isn't causation, and dashboards can create false confidence. Judgment still matters.

climax.text: The best leaders combine data with intuition: use evidence to narrow options, then apply experience to the final call.

punchline.text: Data informs the decision. Leaders make it.

quiz.question: What is the role of data in strategic thinking?
options: It's only useful for technology companies
